title: Purpose of a Control Group
question_text: In an experiment, a control group is used to

choices.text: Control for measurement error by the researchers.
Make sure subjects canâ€™t choose which group they are in.
Serve as a baseline to compare effects of one treatment to a standard treatment or placebo.
Give subjects groups to choose from.

solution:
A control group helps serve as a baseline to compare the effects of one treatment against the status quo.

For example, subjects on a new weight loss drug may have lost weight, but they might have lost weight regardless of the new drug. A control group would help to compare weight loss of the group on the new drug against weight loss of the group on a placebo.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'D'.
